title: For post-menopausal women, vaginal estrogens do not raise risk of cancer, other diseases
institution: University of California - Los Angeles Health Sciences
text:
FINDINGSWomen who have gone through menopause and who have been using a vaginal form of estrogen therapy do not have a higher risk of cardiovascular disease and cancer than women who have not been using any type of estrogen.
BACKGROUND
METHODIMPACTThis study, the first to examine potential adverse health effects in users of vaginal estrogen compared with non-users, suggests that vaginal estrogen therapy is a safe treatment for genitourinary symptoms such as burning, discomfort, and pain during intercourse associated with menopause.
